oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The effect of processing on chokeberry (Aronia Medik.) polyphenols
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Hellström, Jarkko
Rajaniemi, Sirpa
Kivijärvi, Pirjo
Mattila, Pirjo
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Food security, food quality and human health
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
Chokeberries were processed into jams by mixing them with sucrose, water, pectin and citric acid and then boiled. Two different boiling times(5 min and 15 min) were tested.
The phenolic compounds in chokeberries were quite stable during the jam making and 70-75 % of the total phenols were recovered from the processed jams.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Hellström, Jarkko; Rajaniemi, Sirpa; Kivijärvi, Pirjo and Mattila, Pirjo (2007) The effect of processing on chokeberry (Aronia Medik.) polyphenols. In: NJF Report, Nordic Association of Agricultural Scientists, 3 (1), pp. 40-41.
